match.title: 3rd ODI
match.statusText: Zimbabwe won by 6 wickets (with 2 balls remaining)
match.hoursInfo: 09.30 start, First Session 09.30-13.00 Interval 13.00-13.45, Second Session 13.45-17.00

headshotImage.caption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Noor Ali Zadran b Chisoro 56 (108b 3x4 1x6 107m) SR: 51.85

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Noor Ali wanted to sweep this, but he didn't read the pace well and the ball shot past him before he was in position, knocking back his leg stump. Chisoro loves it! He turns and stands, arms outstretched and legs spread wide, in an Afridi-style celebration. That's the breakthrough Zimbabwe needed

image.caption: Tinotenda Mutombodzi at the Under-19 World Cup
image.longCaption: Tinotenda Mutombodzi at the Under-19 World Cup, January 2010

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi run out (Mutombodzi/Panyangara) 42 (54b 2x4 0x6 73m) SR: 77.77

dismissalComment.html: that's the wicket Zimbabwe wanted! And Nabi didn't really look like getting out any other way. Shenwari played the ball to gully once again, who stopped it on the bounce. It's Mutombodzi in that position. He didn't quite stop it cleanly, and Nabi wanted a single off the misfield. Shenwari didn't, and he was probably right, as Tino recovered very quickly and threw the ball to Panyangara with both batsmen staring at each other at the same end.

headshotImage.caption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Noor Ali wanted to sweep this, but he didn't read the pace well and the ball shot past him before he was in position, knocking back his leg stump. Chisoro loves it! He turns and stands, arms outstretched and legs spread wide, in an Afridi-style celebration. That's the breakthrough Zimbabwe needed

he's gone second ball! This was a quicker ball, and it was slightly short. Mangal leaned back to pull, and struck the ball very cleanly. Unfortunately, Luke Jongwe was prowling on the deep midwicket boundary, and he sprinted around to hold an athletic catch, diving forward. That's a really good effort from the fielder. He timed his dive just right, plucking the ball out of the air just in time, and holding on as his elbows hit the turf. Double strike!

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: got him! Shahzad wanted to have a go straight away, and sprinted down the track looking to launch this all the way to Bulawayo Airport. But he ran right past the ball as he swung his bat, and it crashed into his middle stump. Williams breaksthrough!

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: fine catch by Mutumbami! He's not had an easy job behind the stumps today, but this is an excellent reflex catch. Rashid bent low to slog sweep, but turn and bounce meant the ball took a thin top edge. Mutumbami whipped his gloves up and held it cleanly, Nigel Llong upholding the appeal for caught behind.

headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Nawroz Mangal c Jongwe b Chisoro 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: he's gone second ball! This was a quicker ball, and it was slightly short. Mangal leaned back to pull, and struck the ball very cleanly. Unfortunately, Luke Jongwe was prowling on the deep midwicket boundary, and he sprinted around to hold an athletic catch, diving forward. That's a really good effort from the fielder. He timed his dive just right, plucking the ball out of the air just in time, and holding on as his elbows hit the turf. Double strike!

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan c Mutumbami b Jongwe 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Afghanistan are crumbling! Stanikzai has barely allowed himself a sighter at Jongwe, and again he's set himself at the crease and had a huge go at the ball. This time he wanted to attack the leg side, the delivery being just short of a length, but he was beaten by the inward movement, the ball taking the bottom edge and Mutumbami holding a fine catch tumbling forward as the ball died in front of him

image.caption: Tinotenda Mutombodzi at the Under-19 World Cup
image.longCaption: Tinotenda Mutombodzi at the Under-19 World Cup, January 2010

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi run out (Mutombodzi/Panyangara) 42 (54b 2x4 0x6 73m) SR: 77.77

dismissalComment.html: that's the wicket Zimbabwe wanted! And Nabi didn't really look like getting out any other way. Shenwari played the ball to gully once again, who stopped it on the bounce. It's Mutombodzi in that position. He didn't quite stop it cleanly, and Nabi wanted a single off the misfield. Shenwari didn't, and he was probably right, as Tino recovered very quickly and threw the ball to Panyangara with both batsmen staring at each other at the same end.

headshotImage.caption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Samiullah Shinwari b Masakadza 14 (30b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 46.66

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Masakadza strikes straight away! Shenwari set himself for a mighty sweep to leg, but the ball rushed straight on with the arm, nipping under the bat and shattering the timber

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rashid Khan c Mutumbami b Williams 15 (27b 1x4 0x6 21m) SR: 55.55

dismissalComment.html: fine catch by Mutumbami! He's not had an easy job behind the stumps today, but this is an excellent reflex catch. Rashid bent low to slog sweep, but turn and bounce meant the ball took a thin top edge. Mutumbami whipped his gloves up and held it cleanly, Nigel Llong upholding the appeal for caught behind.

dismissalText.commentary: Shafiqullah c Chibhabha b Panyangara 35 (32b 2x4 2x6 54m) SR: 109.37

dismissalComment.html: safe hands! Chamu is usually very good on the high ball and in the outfield. Shafiqullah wanted to blast another six, but he got much more height than distance in the shot. Chamu had to run in as the ball swirled around in a strong breeze, but he set himself right underneath it and held on.

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Rashid Khan b Amir Hamza
dismissalText.commentary: Richmond Mutumbami c Rashid Khan b Amir Hamza 74 (92b 4x4 2x6 111m) SR: 80.43

dismissalComment.html: caught this time! And this was a really good effort, on the run. Mutumbami kneeled down to slog sweep, and though he got a good connection he didn't get it wide enough of a sprinting fielder at deep midwicket. It's Rashid.

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura not out 49 (62b 2x4 0x6 93m) SR: 79.03

dismissalComment.html: what a way to get a wicket! Chamu backed away and chopped down on the ball, which bounced and was headed back towards the stumps. He stuck his hand out to catch it, reflexively, and tossed it away. Shahzad was alert to the error, appealing straight away, and Nigel Llong gives Chamu out for handling the ball. Chamu is the first Zim batsman to be given out handling the ball
bowled him! Ervine comes half forward, and the ball spins in sharply through bat and pad to castle him. Afghanistan break through, somewhat against the run of play.

caught this time! And this was a really good effort, on the run. Mutumbami kneeled down to slog sweep, and though he got a good connection he didn't get it wide enough of a sprinting fielder at deep midwicket. It's Rashid.

caught at long on! One felt that something like this was coming. He wanted to hurry Zimbabwe's win, but he's chipped the ball cleanly down long on's throat. It's probably too little too late for Afghanistan.

dismissalText.commentary: Chamu Chibhabha handled the ball 18 (33b 1x4 0x6 41m) SR: 54.54

dismissalComment.html: what a way to get a wicket! Chamu backed away and chopped down on the ball, which bounced and was headed back towards the stumps. He stuck his hand out to catch it, reflexively, and tossed it away. Shahzad was alert to the error, appealing straight away, and Nigel Llong gives Chamu out for handling the ball. Chamu is the first Zim batsman to be given out handling the ball

dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine b Amir Hamza 11 (30b 1x4 0x6 49m) SR: 36.66

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Ervine comes half forward, and the ball spins in sharply through bat and pad to castle him. Afghanistan break through, somewhat against the run of play.

headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Noor Ali Zadran b Amir Hamza
dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams c Noor Ali Zadran b Amir Hamza 39 (59b 1x4 0x6 82m) SR: 66.1

dismissalComment.html: caught at long on! One felt that something like this was coming. He wanted to hurry Zimbabwe's win, but he's chipped the ball cleanly down long on's throat. It's probably too little too late for Afghanistan.

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: No worries at all from Raza. With all the fielders up inside the circle, he picked up a length delivery and mowed it straight back down the ground. An emphatic full stop to the match!

commentPostTextItems.html: 4:55pm: Thanks for joining us today in our coverage of Zimbabwe's six-wicket win that gives them a 2-1 lead in the series, with two games to play. Your commentator has been Liam Brickhill. Look out for my match report in the next few minutes, and please do join me again for the fourth game. Until then, goodbye!
4:50pm: Richmond Mutumbami is Man of the Match for his 74.

Chigumbura leads the players off, Zimbabwe win by six wickets. pic.twitter.com/vsZXXIFoUW

— Liam Brickhill (@Gomorezvidinha) October 20, 2015

4:45pm: Well, it came down to the final over, but it seemed Zimbabwe were always just in front in this chase. Mutumbami's aggressive knock ensured a good start, and though neither Chibhabha nor Ervine made their presence felt, Zimbabwe never lost wickets in clumps. Williams and Chigumbura added 61 in partnership to take Zimbabwe close, and then Raza came out and hurried things along with a quickfire 29. Zimbabwe will also be pleased that Chigumbura spent some time at the wicket, regaining confidence and timing to see Zimbabwe home. Afghanistan really lost this game through their middle order slump - without that collapse, they'd have reached a much more challenging total.

commentTextItems.html: another Bulls-eye yorker! Chigumbura swings at it, and the inside edge flies past the stumps and down to fine leg.

commentPreTextItems.html: The only fielders out on the boundary are third man, fine leg and deep square.

commentTextItems.html: single to third man, off the bottom edge. Again Dawlat was on target with the yorker, but the ball went to the man on the boundary.

commentPreTextItems.html: Last over coming up. Zimbabwe need three to win. Chigumbura needs one for his fifty.

commentTextItems.html: dot ball! Dawlat spears in a reverse swinging yorker, and Raza can only dig it out to cover.
tip and run single! Raza drove the ball hard, and straight at cover. The batsmen charged through for the single, trusting that the fielder couldn't hit the stumps. And, indeed, he could not.
that will help Zimbabwe! Aftab hurls one down the leg side, and is called for a wide.
a toe-ended drive flies down to third man. Just the one.

commentPostTextItems.html: There's a long conference between captain and bowler ahead of Aftab's final delivery. Long on, deep square and fine leg are out, as is third man.

commentTextItems.html: play and a miss! Chigumbura swings mightily at a full ball outside off, but he can't connect.
another full toss, and it's flicked to deep square leg.
in the air ... And safe! Mid off is up inside the circle now, with Afghanistan looking to save runs. Chigumbura wanted to smite this length delivery to wide long off, but it hit the bat really high.
Raza comes forward to drive, and the cover sweeper keeps them to one.
a full toss on middle is flapped out into the deep with a wristy flick, just the single

commentPostTextItems.html: Zimbabwe are well on top, but there are still nine runs to get, and a tight over here could take it into the final over. And then, anything could happen ...

commentTextItems.html: crunched through cover point. Firmly hit, but there's cover on the boundary.
Chigumbura swings hard at a length delivery, and the ball flies off the edge and quite fine down to third man. He's one hit away from fifty now.
punched to mid off, who is up now, but it's just wide enough of him to allow a scampered single.
up and over extra cover! This is the length Raza has been waiting for, and he leans forward into a majestic, lofted drive. Inside out, and over the infield.
Raza is cramped for room by one that swings in towards middle and off, nudging the ball back down the track.
slashed square off the front foot, and they put the point fielder under pressure with a quick single. He stops it, but not cleanly.
chopped to point, who stops it cleanly this time.
on a length, just outside off, and Chigumbura stands at the crease to force a single to long off.

dismissalText.commentary: Noor Ali Zadran b Chisoro 56 (108b 3x4 1x6 107m) SR: 51.85

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Noor Ali wanted to sweep this, but he didn't read the pace well and the ball shot past him before he was in position, knocking back his leg stump. Chisoro loves it! He turns and stands, arms outstretched and legs spread wide, in an Afridi-style celebration. That's the breakthrough Zimbabwe needed

headshotImage.caption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tendai Chisoro player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Nawroz Mangal c Jongwe b Chisoro 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: he's gone second ball! This was a quicker ball, and it was slightly short. Mangal leaned back to pull, and struck the ball very cleanly. Unfortunately, Luke Jongwe was prowling on the deep midwicket boundary, and he sprinted around to hold an athletic catch, diving forward. That's a really good effort from the fielder. He timed his dive just right, plucking the ball out of the air just in time, and holding on as his elbows hit the turf. Double strike!

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan c Mutumbami b Jongwe 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Afghanistan are crumbling! Stanikzai has barely allowed himself a sighter at Jongwe, and again he's set himself at the crease and had a huge go at the ball. This time he wanted to attack the leg side, the delivery being just short of a length, but he was beaten by the inward movement, the ball taking the bottom edge and Mutumbami holding a fine catch tumbling forward as the ball died in front of him

image.caption: Tinotenda Mutombodzi at the Under-19 World Cup
image.longCaption: Tinotenda Mutombodzi at the Under-19 World Cup, January 2010

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi run out (Mutombodzi/Panyangara) 42 (54b 2x4 0x6 73m) SR: 77.77

dismissalComment.html: that's the wicket Zimbabwe wanted! And Nabi didn't really look like getting out any other way. Shenwari played the ball to gully once again, who stopped it on the bounce. It's Mutombodzi in that position. He didn't quite stop it cleanly, and Nabi wanted a single off the misfield. Shenwari didn't, and he was probably right, as Tino recovered very quickly and threw the ball to Panyangara with both batsmen staring at each other at the same end.

headshotImage.caption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Samiullah Shinwari b Masakadza 14 (30b 0x4 0x6 21m) SR: 46.66

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Masakadza strikes straight away! Shenwari set himself for a mighty sweep to leg, but the ball rushed straight on with the arm, nipping under the bat and shattering the timber

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rashid Khan c Mutumbami b Williams 15 (27b 1x4 0x6 21m) SR: 55.55

dismissalComment.html: fine catch by Mutumbami! He's not had an easy job behind the stumps today, but this is an excellent reflex catch. Rashid bent low to slog sweep, but turn and bounce meant the ball took a thin top edge. Mutumbami whipped his gloves up and held it cleanly, Nigel Llong upholding the appeal for caught behind.

dismissalText.commentary: Shafiqullah c Chibhabha b Panyangara 35 (32b 2x4 2x6 54m) SR: 109.37

dismissalComment.html: safe hands! Chamu is usually very good on the high ball and in the outfield. Shafiqullah wanted to blast another six, but he got much more height than distance in the shot. Chamu had to run in as the ball swirled around in a strong breeze, but he set himself right underneath it and held on.

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Rashid Khan b Amir Hamza
dismissalText.commentary: Richmond Mutumbami c Rashid Khan b Amir Hamza 74 (92b 4x4 2x6 111m) SR: 80.43

dismissalComment.html: caught this time! And this was a really good effort, on the run. Mutumbami kneeled down to slog sweep, and though he got a good connection he didn't get it wide enough of a sprinting fielder at deep midwicket. It's Rashid.

dismissalText.commentary: Chamu Chibhabha handled the ball 18 (33b 1x4 0x6 41m) SR: 54.54

dismissalComment.html: what a way to get a wicket! Chamu backed away and chopped down on the ball, which bounced and was headed back towards the stumps. He stuck his hand out to catch it, reflexively, and tossed it away. Shahzad was alert to the error, appealing straight away, and Nigel Llong gives Chamu out for handling the ball. Chamu is the first Zim batsman to be given out handling the ball

dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine b Amir Hamza 11 (30b 1x4 0x6 49m) SR: 36.66

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Ervine comes half forward, and the ball spins in sharply through bat and pad to castle him. Afghanistan break through, somewhat against the run of play.

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Noor Ali Zadran b Amir Hamza
dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams c Noor Ali Zadran b Amir Hamza 39 (59b 1x4 0x6 82m) SR: 66.1

dismissalComment.html: caught at long on! One felt that something like this was coming. He wanted to hurry Zimbabwe's win, but he's chipped the ball cleanly down long on's throat. It's probably too little too late for Afghanistan.

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura not out 49 (62b 2x4 0x6 93m) SR: 79.03
Sikandar Raza not out 29 (23b 1x4 1x6 35m) SR: 126.08

image.longCaption: Tinotenda Mutombodzi at the Under-19 World Cup, January 2010

stories.title: Zimbabwe v Afghanistan, 2015-16
stories.subTitle: 3rd ODI, Bulawayo
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: Zimbabwe v Afghanistan, 2015-16
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the third ODI, Zimbabwe v Afghanistan, 2015-16

stories.title: 'It was my lucky day' - Mutumbami
stories.subTitle: Zimbabwe v Afghanistan, 3rd ODI, Bulawayo
stories.seoTitle: 'It was my lucky day' - Richmond Mutumbami
stories.summary: Richmond Mutumbami played the anchor role in Zimbabwe's six-wicket win, with a career-best 74, against Afghanistan in the third ODI to give his team a 2-1 lead

image.caption: The Zimbabwe team celebrates a wicket
image.longCaption: The Zimbabwe team celebrates a wicket, Zimbabwe v Afghanistan, 3rd ODI, Bulawayo, October 20, 2015

stories.title: Mutumbami, Chigumbura give Zimbabwe 2-1 lead
stories.subTitle: Zimbabwe v Afghanistan, 3rd ODI, Bulawayo
stories.summary: Richmond Mutumbami's 74 helped Zimbabwe to secure a 2-1 series lead with a six-wicket victory in the third one-day international against Afghanistan at Queens Sports Club

image.caption: Richmond Mutumbami targets the leg side
image.longCaption: Richmond Mutumbami targets the leg side, Zimbabwe v Afghanistan, 3rd ODI, Bulawayo, October 20, 2015

stories.title: Williams set to return as teams scrap for lead
stories.subTitle: Zimbabwe v Afghanistan, 3rd ODI, Bulawayo
stories.seoTitle: Williams set to return as teams scrap for lead
stories.summary: The last time Afghanistan came to Zimbabwe, in 2014, a four-match one-day series was shared 2-2, and indications are that this series could shape up in a similar manner

image.caption: Elton Chigumbura was out for 10
